trans-unit.source: Markdown is generally quick and easy to author, but creating tables is a well-known challenge.
trans-unit.target: Markdown is generally quick and easy to author, but creating tables is a well-known challenge.

trans-unit.source: Before looking at tooling to help create tables, it's worth knowing how to author them natively in GitHub-flavored markdown ("strict" markdown does not provide any table support, but GitHub does support them):
trans-unit.target: Before looking at tooling to help create tables, it's worth knowing how to author them natively in GitHub-flavored markdown ("strict" markdown does not provide any table support, but GitHub does support them):

trans-unit.source: There are some **web-based** tools that will allow you build your table online and then copy and paste the resulting markdown into your editor.
trans-unit.target: There are some **web-based** tools that will allow you build your table online and then copy and paste the resulting markdown into your editor.

trans-unit.source: [Markdown Tables Generator](http://www.tablesgenerator.com/markdown_tables) -- It can also general tables in HTML and LaTeX
trans-unit.target: [Markdown Tables Generator](http://www.tablesgenerator.com/markdown_tables) -- It can also general tables in HTML and LaTeX

trans-unit.source: Different markdown editors handle tables with different levels of sophistication.
trans-unit.target: Different markdown editors handle tables with different levels of sophistication.

trans-unit.source: [MarkdownPad Pro](http://www.markdownpad.com/) has very good table support, but you'll need to pay have the $15 Pro version for GitHub-flavored markdown support.
trans-unit.target: [MarkdownPad Pro](http://www.markdownpad.com/) has very good table support, but you'll need to pay have the $15 Pro version for GitHub-flavored markdown support.

trans-unit.source: [Atom](http://atom.io) has an add-in package called **markdown-table-formatter** that lets you create a table via GUI.
trans-unit.target: [Atom](http://atom.io) has an add-in package called **markdown-table-formatter** that lets you create a table via GUI.
